contentrichtext.text: {{Japanese city |Name = Katashina |JapaneseName = 片品村 |settlement_type = Village |MapImage = Katashina in Gunma Prefecture Ja.svg |Prefecture = [[Gunma Prefecture]] |Region = [[Kantō region|Kantō]] |Area_km2 = 392.01 |Population = 5,143 |PopDate = February 1, 2012 |Density_km2 = 13.12 |Coords = {{coord|36|46|N|139|14|E|region:JP_type:city}} |LatitudeDegrees = 36 |LatitudeMinutes = 46 |LatitudeSeconds = |LongtitudeDegrees = 139 |LongtitudeMinutes = 14 |LongtitudeSeconds = |Area code = |Mayor = Kinzo Chigira (since November 2005) |Tree = Betula platyphylla |Flower = Lysichiton camtschatcense |Bird = [[Copper Pheasant]] |SymbolImage = |CityHallPostalCode = 378-0498 |CityHallAddress = Katashina-mura, 3967-3 Ōaza Kamata |CityHallPhone = 0278-58-2111 |CityHallLink = [http://www.vill.katashina.gunma.jp/ Village of Katashina] |CityMap = |Elevation = }} [[Image:Sonohara-609-r1.jpg|thumb|200px|right|Sonohara Dam]] {{nihongo|'''Katashina'''|片品村|Katashina-mura}} is a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Tone District, Gunma|Tone District]], [[Gunma Prefecture|Gunma]], [[Japan]]. As of February 1, 2012, the village has an estimated [[population]] of 5,143, with 1,697 [[Household|households]] and a [[population density|density]] of 13.12 persons per km². The total area is 392.01 km². ==Geography== Located near [[Gunma Prefecture|Gunma's]] border with [[Tochigi prefecture]], the town is very mountainous, with the highest elevation being 2578m and the lowest 640m. The temperature can reach up to 36°C in the summer, but in the winter, it can drop to -18°C. The average temperature is 11°C, the yearly precipitation is 1042 mm, and amount of snowfall is 95cm, with the snowy period lasting for 120 days.<ref>[http://www.vill.katashina.gunma.jp/shoukai/enkaku-sonsyou/enkaku.html 片品村の沿革・位置・地勢・気象<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> * [[Mountains]]: Mount Nikko Shirane, Mount Shibutsu, Mount Hotaka * [[Rivers]]: Katashina River, Ōtaki River * [[Lakes]]: Marunuma (Maru Swamp) ==Surrounding municipalities== * [[Gunma Prefecture]] ** [[Numata, Gunma|Numata]] ** [[Minakami, Gunma|Minakami]] **[[Kawaba, Gunma|Kawaba]] * [[Tochigi Prefecture]] ** [[Nikko, Tochigi|Nikko]] * [[Fukushima Prefecture]] ** [[Hinoemata, Fukushima|Hinoemata]] * [[Niigata Prefecture]] ** [[Uonuma, Niigata|Uonuma]] ==Notable places== * Katashina Hot Springs * [[Ozegahara]] * Marunuma Dam * Sonohara Dam * Konsei Mountain Pass * Chigira Farm * Marunuma Plateau Ski　Resort * Katashina Plateau Ski Resort ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category-inline}} * [http://www.vill.katashina.gunma.jp/ Katashina official website] {{ja icon}} * [http://www.oze-fnd.or.jp/english/frmain_e.html The Oze Preservation Foundation English website] [[Category:Villages in Gunma Prefecture]] {{Gunma-geo-stub}}
